text: to her family she was Chrissy a person
who had room in her heart for everyone
they said who believed that every person
should be valued and respected Christine
had moved to Europe from Canada to be
with her boyfriend Tyler on Saturday
night she died in Tyler's arms they've
been walking over London Bridge as the
attack began the van hit 30 year old
Christine her boyfriend's family say he
tried desperately to keep her alive and
paramedics were on the scene very
quickly but there was nothing they could
do to save her
in a statement her family said she
wouldn't have understood the callous
cruelty of her death they also made this
plea please honor her by making your
community a better place volunteer your
time and labor or donate to a homeless
shelter
tell them chrissy sent you christian
archibald had worked in a homeless
shelter back in canada she'd studied
social work at university in calgary
where she was remembered as a shy
talented student the area of social work
that she chose to working is one of the
most challenging areas requires
substantial commitment substantial
compassion and she was able to do that
really successfully she would be
somebody that we'd be quite proud to
have called a Social Work colleague
Australian candies hedge was stabbed in
the neck on Saturday night she's been
trying to hide from the attackers in
Borough Market her family believes she's
actually one of the lucky ones I was
really scared yeah I was really really
scared but um where I eventually got on
to the hospital and they spoke to me and
they said that um you know she had gone
to surgery and she had a you know not a
knife wound in the neck across London
Hospital the injured are still being
treated at King's College Hospital seven
people remain critically ill all our
patients have been cared for by our
intensive care and surgical teams who
are doing an excellent job we have a
number of patients who remain in
critical care where they're receiving
good treatment and I expect those
patients to remain there for a number of
to come yet in the coming hours and days
the names of the six other people killed
will be made public as well the anguish
and pain of their family and friends
Daniella Ralf BBC News
